title: rustc bug  - index out of bounds

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
short summary of the bug:\
Unexpectedly the compiler return an error.\
I compile on WSL1 Debian on Win10.\
 \
I tried this code in this commit:\
`https://github.com/LucianoBestia/crates_io_database/commit/18b625fe64c4a54d871fc0f21ad6e6994dc11fab`\
\
code sample that causes the bug:\
I run this command:\
`$ clear; cargo test`\
\
I expected to see this happen:\
tests pass or fail.\
\
Instead, this happened: \
\
```
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 559 but the index is 560', /rustc/4fb7144ed159f94491249e86d5bbd033b5d60550/src/libcore/slice/mod.rs:2842:10
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.43.0 (4fb7144ed 2020-04-20) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden
```
## Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:\
\
```
rustc 1.43.0 (4fb7144ed 2020-04-20)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 4fb7144ed159f94491249e86d5bbd033b5d60550
commit-date: 2020-04-20
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.43.0
LLVM version: 9.0
```

Backtrace:  
